EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION RESOURCES
plans as that adopted in Oklahoma. The involvement of educators, civic groups,
legislatures, foundations and commercial interests in educational television is sufficient
to indicate the possibility of a hundred educational television stations within the next five
years.
The members of the 1953 Lincoln Lodge Seminar hope that the reports which grew
out of their weeksâ€™ deliberations, together with the formal addresses which preceded
them, will help give direction and purpose to these new educational television stations.
